channel.title: Comments on: Review: BadukTV by GoGameGuru

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: That's a good point. I forgot that there was such a rank discrepancy when it came to Korean ranks versus KGS ranks. I haven't gotten a chance to check out the "searching for exquisite moves" yet, but I will definitely make it a higher priority on the list since you recommend it!
item.content:encoded: That’s a good point. I forgot that there was such a rank discrepancy when it came to Korean ranks versus KGS ranks. I haven’t gotten a chance to check out the “searching for exquisite moves” yet, but I will definitely make it a higher priority on the list since you recommend it!

item.title: By: John Hughes
item.dc:creator: John Hughes
item.description: though that's Korean 5kyu, which is a fair bit stronger than KGS 5 kyu - 1 kyu is the top Korean rank for an amateur, in case you don't know. But yeah BadukTV is pretty good. I especially liked the game review series "searching for exquisite moves" last time I was subscribed (and I will do again in the future).
item.content:encoded: though that’s Korean 5kyu, which is a fair bit stronger than KGS 5 kyu – 1 kyu is the top Korean rank for an amateur, in case you don’t know. But yeah BadukTV is pretty good. I especially liked the game review series “searching for exquisite moves” last time I was subscribed (and I will do again in the future).

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Thanks for letting me know! I've heard a lot of things about him, but haven't had a chance to check him out. I'm glad to get your consensus on him as well, so I will definitely have to check it out. =D
item.content:encoded: Thanks for letting me know! I’ve heard a lot of things about him, but haven’t had a chance to check him out. I’m glad to get your consensus on him as well, so I will definitely have to check it out. =D

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Yes. They are scheduled to release at a minimum of 8 translated videos a month. This refers to videos that are translated via English subtitles (and not translated voice). In my experience so far, the quality of translations has been very good and it doesn't bother me that it's not orally translated. In terms of the number of English subtitled videos that are on-demand, there are 100+ by my count, and the number is only growing! Let me know if you have any more questions! Hope this helped!
item.content:encoded:
Yes. They are scheduled to release at a minimum of 8 translated videos a month. This refers to videos that are translated via English subtitles (and not translated voice). In my experience so far, the quality of translations has been very good and it doesn’t bother me that it’s not orally translated.
In terms of the number of English subtitled videos that are on-demand, there are 100+ by my count, and the number is only growing!
Let me know if you have any more questions! Hope this helped!

item.title: By: ricardo
item.dc:creator: ricardo
item.description: acording to GGG the translated videos are 8 in a month? that means english by koreans, translated (voice) or subtitled in english? and how many subtitled videos are on-demand?
item.content:encoded: acording to GGG the translated videos are 8 in a month? that means english by koreans, translated (voice) or subtitled in english? and how many subtitled videos are on-demand?

item.title: By: scott
item.dc:creator: scott
item.description: On the off chance that you don't already watch this guy's videos, you should check out http://www.youtube.com/user/nicksibicky . He has some excellent videos on topic besides high level game reviews. Nobody I know of does videos like his on youtube.
item.content:encoded:
On the off chance that you don’t already watch this guy’s videos, you should check out http://www.youtube.com/user/nicksibicky .
He has some excellent videos on topic besides high level game reviews. Nobody I know of does videos like his on youtube.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I use AppleTV. It allows me to mirror my laptop/iPad which makes for an incredibly convenient way for me to watch whatever the heart desires. =)
item.content:encoded: I use AppleTV. It allows me to mirror my laptop/iPad which makes for an incredibly convenient way for me to watch whatever the heart desires. =)

item.title: By: Todd Bowlby
item.dc:creator: Todd Bowlby
item.description: What do you use to stream to your TV? I have a ps3, but I've had problems getting it to work with videos from youtube (I know there's an ap of some sort, but it isn't available in Canada for some dumb reason), so I have no idea how well or conveniently it'll work with baduktv. Anyway, I've been thinking about baduktv for some time, and If I solve this issue, it's only a matter of time before I end up with a subscription myself; I don't think I could help myself.;)
item.content:encoded: What do you use to stream to your TV? I have a ps3, but I’ve had problems getting it to work with videos from youtube (I know there’s an ap of some sort, but it isn’t available in Canada for some dumb reason), so I have no idea how well or conveniently it’ll work with baduktv. Anyway, I’ve been thinking about baduktv for some time, and If I solve this issue, it’s only a matter of time before I end up with a subscription myself; I don’t think I could help myself.;)
